conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_C.

At this stage, the allocation is not yet finalized and we cannot reliably predict whether higher-priority families will still apply to Nursery_C in upcoming rounds. In particular, there are families who rank Nursery_C highly and may approach us later depending on outcomes at their first-choice nurseries.

For that reason, we are still holding our remaining place in line with our priority order, and we’re not yet in a position to indicate that the process is “close to finalized” for Nursery_C.

We appreciate that Nursery_C is your first choice, and if circumstances change (e.g., if it becomes clear the place will not be taken by a higher-priority family), we will reassess at that time. In the meantime, we would encourage you to continue conversations with other nurseries as well so you are not left without an option.

Kind regards,
Nursery_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on our true priority list (behind Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D). So the main realistic higher-priority risk is Parent_B; Parent_A/Parent_D are unlikely to apply unless rejected everywhere. Nursery_E is top for Parent_B but Nursery_E prioritizes Parent_E first, then Parent_B, so Parent_B could still end up displaced and turn to us. Given this uncertainty at round 5, we should not commit to Parent_E yet, but we can be transparent that we cannot forecast and that we’re still holding capacity for higher-priority families. Parent_E sent [TALK], so respond with [TALK] and encourage them to keep options open while we cannot provide timeline guarantees.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_C.

On your questions: we’re not able to confirm whether specific families above you in our priority order have applied or indicated intentions, as we must treat other families’ communications as confidential. More generally, we also can’t set a fixed round or guarantee a timing for an offer, because families’ decisions can change quickly depending on outcomes at their higher-ranked nurseries.

What we can say is this: we will continue to hold our remaining place in line with our priority order, and we would only move to the next eligible family (including you) if it becomes clear that no higher-priority family is in a position to take the place.

We appreciate that Nursery_C is your first choice, and we encourage you to keep pursuing other options in parallel so you are not left without a placement. If your situation changes (e.g., you accept elsewhere), please do let us know.

Kind regards,
Nursery_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on Nursery_C’s true priority list (B, A, D, E, C). We still have quota 1 and are currently unmatched. Given the mechanism, higher-priority Parent_B could plausibly come to us if rejected elsewhere, so holding capacity remains optimal. Parent_E asked for information; we should respond with a [TALK] message: we cannot disclose other families’ communications, and we can’t commit to a specific round; we can state we will consider offering if it becomes clear higher-priority applicants are no longer active/available, and encourage them to keep other options open.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions,

Thank you for your continued correspondence. I remain actively seeking a place, and Nursery_C is still our first choice—if offered, we will accept immediately.

I understand you must follow your priority order and can’t discuss other families. Could you please advise, in general terms, what you need to see before you are able to move to the next eligible family (e.g., do you wait until the end of a given round, or until you receive explicit declines from higher-priority families)? If there is any additional information from us that would be helpful to keep our application “ready” should the place become available, I would be glad to provide it.

Kind regards,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. However, repeated APPLY attempts have been rejected because they are holding for higher-priority families. Another immediate APPLY is unlikely to change the outcome this round; a TALK message that (i) confirms I am still actively seeking placement, (ii) reiterates immediate acceptance, and (iii) asks what concrete information they can share about when/under what condition they would move down the priority list may increase the chance they consider me promptly if higher-priority families do not materialize.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for keeping us updated. In general terms, we keep an application “ready” once we have a clear statement of interest (which you’ve provided) and basic enrolment/eligibility details; there is nothing further you need to submit right now for us to consider you promptly if we are able to move to the next family.

On timing/conditions: we typically only move down our priority order when, by the end of a round, it is clear that higher-priority families are either already placed elsewhere or have not applied/are not in a position to take the place at that point. Because families’ situations can change from round to round, we can’t commit to a specific round when we would be able to make an offer.

If you would like to help us act quickly should the place become available, you can reply confirming (1) your child’s intended start date and schedule needs, and (2) that you can accept immediately if offered. Beyond that, the best step is to continue pursuing other options in parallel, and keep us informed if you accept a place elsewhere.

Kind regards,
Nursery_C Admissions

[TALK]

2) Schedule needs: we are flexible and can accommodate your available schedule; please let us know the days/hours you can offer and we will confirm promptly.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions,

I’m writing to formally apply in this round for the remaining place.

Nursery_C remains our first choice. If offered, I can accept immediately and will withdraw from all other options. We can start right away and are fully flexible on schedule (we will take any days/hours you can offer).

If by the end of this round it becomes clear that no higher-priority family is able to take the place, I would be very grateful to be considered next.

Kind regards,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Although they have repeatedly rejected me due to higher-priority families possibly applying later, the only way to be considered if those families do not materialize is to continue submitting formal applications each round while clearly stating immediate acceptance and flexibility. I will apply again, succinctly reaffirming readiness to accept immediately and asking to be considered if no higher-priority family takes the place this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for applying again this round and for clearly confirming that Nursery_C remains your first choice and that you can accept immediately with full schedule flexibility.

At this time, we are still not able to offer you the place. We must continue to hold our remaining capacity in line with our priority order while higher-priority families may still apply in upcoming rounds.

We appreciate your continued interest, and if circumstances change such that we are able to move to the next eligible family, we will reassess promptly. In the meantime, we strongly encourage you to continue pursuing other options in parallel so you are not left without a placement.

Kind regards,
Nursery_C Admissions

Parent_C also ranks Nursery_C 2nd, and Parent_A/D include Nursery_C but rank it last; still, they are above Parent_E in our priority. With rounds remaining (current round 12 of 30), accepting Parent_E now would foreclose the chance to match with a higher-priority parent later. Given we prefer leaving the seat unfilled rather than taking someone outside the list (and Parent_E is on the list but low), the optimal strategy is to continue rejecting Parent_E while holding capacity for higher-priority parents who may apply in later rounds. No other messages this round change that calculus.
